intro: Psephellus xanthocephalus subsp. xanthocephaloides, commonly known as the yellow-headed psephellus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils in grassland habitats. It produces small, cylindrical flower heads that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different flower coloration and growth form compared to the main species.
